abstract: Arizona is first state to enact law which requires high school students to pass citizenship exam to graduate; critics say test takes away from valuable instruction time and simply requires memorization to pass, whereas teaching civics supports critical thinking and student engagement; other states are considering similar bill.
lead_paragraph: Arizona became the first state to require its high school students to pass the test that is given to immigrants who want to become United States citizens.

byline.contributor: Rick Rojas reported from Phoenix, and Motoko Rich from New York.
byline.original: By RICK ROJAS and MOTOKO RICH

headline.main: States Move to Make Citizenship Exams a Classroom Aid
